Reviews.Title: WORKED GREAT ON POOL PIPE LEAK
Reviews.Author: JP

} // ]]> var cv_moTE14MTLBTOXMRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_moTE14MTLBTOXMRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Y58NHUKCS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_moTE14MTLBTOXMpreplay.parentNode; var cv_moTE14MTLBTOXMcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moTE14MTLBTOXMcurrentClick) { return cv_moTE14MTLBTOXMcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:14 MinsHad a pool line leaking, snaked camera into pipe with the pump running and around 12' in I found a hole in the pipe. Sure worth its weight in gold. Did add silicone around the cap and the tail after reading some of the other reviews about issues with leaking.Video is rather clear.

Reviews.Title: cheap but worth the money! (needs external light source)
Reviews.Author: S. Eckert
Reviews.Content: Others say it won't work with Vista... but my Media Center PC running Windoze Vista recognized it immediately. Didn't have to install any drivers or any software. Roxio recognized the camera and would record from it. Windoze seems not to know it's there... so I just copied the executable AMCAP.EXE from the mini-CD and ran it. Done (no need to install, it just runs). Can see real-time preview in a stretchable window, can record to AVI disk file, simple and no hassle. Haven't found a way to store snapshots yet, but I have a movie player that can do that so I just record and capture stills later.Video quality is just fine for a $34 item.... if there is plenty of light. The shutter speed is slow so the image blurs if there is movement. It's not a multi-megapixel point-and-shoot, and the image can be a bit hazy due to the plastic protective cover, but there's a menu in the viewer to adjust brightness/contrast/white balance, etc. It probably won't last very long and the plastic cover will probably scratch, but if I use it 2 or 3 times I figure I've gotten my money's worth.The same product seems to come with many different length cables. Cables longer than this one apparently have a repeater box which means they won't thread through small pipes and that box isn't waterproof. This one has a brightness wheel on the USB connector and nothing but cable to the camera.UPDATE 1: Just had exactly the same experince on a Windoze 7 laptop. Plug it in, let Windoze install drivers, copy software from the mini-CD, run the software without installing. The mini-CD software can also access the laptop's built-in webcam.UPDATE 2: It survived being pushed down a driveway drain pipe with standing water, taped to a tape-style snake, but to my dismay I discovered that cranking up the LEDs causes reflection inside the plastic cover. Bad reflections! If there's really no light at all where you're using it, your range of site is extremely limited because the internal reflections wash out the image unless you turn the brightness down on the LEDs. This took it from 5 stars (cheap but you get what you pay for) to 4 stars (cheap and you need external lighting).

Reviews.Title: Did exaclty what I needed it to do !!!
Reviews.Author: John Grooms
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use it to 'see' behind walls and ceilings, and it worked perfectly for that. Having an adjustable LED brightness was a bonus - although I typically used it at highest brightness to see as 'far' as possible ahead. There was insulation in all spaces I used it for, and that wreaks havoc with the camera due to reflections from the LED's, but I was able to work around this. With help from the camera, taped to end of fish tape, and nylon rods at other times, and 10-gauge copper wire for shorter distances, I was able to see and (1) fish wire and fish tape through holes, (2) see fish tape and grab it from 'the other end' (meeting in the middle), (3) check for previous wire or plumbing that I DIDN'T want to drill through (saw both, and was able to avoid drilling through), and (4) identify obstructions in blind spaces like wooden fire breaks and floor joist stiffening blocks between the joists. The display on my laptop was very good (close focal range on camera), and the software supplied ran fine, and included several image enhancement options (brightness, contrast, etc.) I solved the 'issue' some people complain about with these, of not being able to tell which way is up or down, by taping the camera to the fish tape or rod, with enough of the guide leader sticking out in front of the camera, so that it could always be seen by the camera. Then, I taped the camera to the leader while watching the display, orienting the camera so that 'down' was always towards the leader. Then, where I could keep the leader oriented from the 'push end' (easier with flat fish tape), it was easy and intuitive to tell up/down direction. In retrospect, I didn't need anywhere near all 10m of USB cable, but it doesn't hurt having it! I'll be using this 'tool' a lot, and only wish I'd had it long ago, when I did a lot more of this kind of blind work.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised. Not really waterproof.
Reviews.Author: M. K. Mcgregor "Everything electronic!"
Reviews.Content: Not the best view in the world, and software is just ok to make it work. However, it does what it says other than being "water proof". It's not, and I would not recommend drowning it.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof - not recommended
Reviews.Author: Christopher Milkosky "Chris M"
Reviews.Content: First time I used it in the water it worked for about 20 seconds and water leaked into it and destroyed it.  Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: It's got some issues, but it's worth the money
Reviews.Author: HugeStakkaBoFan
Reviews.Content: The resolution's not so great and the internal light source definitely glares off of the clear plastic cap, but If you ever need to see down pipes, behind appliances or inside of walls, this thing is a real wallet saver. Tape it to the end of a fiberglass wire pulling rod and you've got yourself a much better sewer cam than your top-dollar plumber does. It might not last forever, but one good use will more than justify the cost.

Reviews.Title: Used it to peek behind the drywall before making large holes
Reviews.Author: RV
Reviews.Content: Used it to peek behind the drywall before making larger holes. For my projects it does not need to be waterproofDoes a good job considering the price.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: HR
Reviews.Content: the one I got was DOA. I wanted to use it to inspect my chimney between sweeper visits... was a good form factor and seems like it would have worked...

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Travis Dixon
Reviews.Content: Resolution is very limited, and grainy, but it's basically what I expected, and I'd say I got my money's worth.Worked great on both Mac OSX "Mavericks" (Photobooth as viewer, probably iMovie too) as well as Linux (Ubuntu 13.10, using camorama as the viewer). Didn't try it on Windows.I taped it to a piece of fish tape to make a poor mans inspection camera, looking for holes in my siding. Little hard to control, but got the job done.The USB light control is real touchy - goes from Dim to Full Blast without much in between. Build quality is mediocre - there's an obvious piece of glue or something that might be in the way of the lens, but not worth dealing with for my uses.  Didn't test the water resistance.It's one of those things that I'll find another use for eventually and be glad I had it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: scott davis
Reviews.Content: This camera works great.  I didnt use the software for it i use manycam instead but the camera works great on it.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: YMMV
Reviews.Content: I needed to find where some roots were getting into the sewer lateral, and this got the job done.  I centered the camera head in the end of a coil-spring manual sewer snake and secured it with vinyl electrician's tape (the cable is only an electrical conductor, so you'll need something else to take the camera head down the pipe) and sent it down hole, recording the images on a laptop computer using a generic USB camera driver I found online, then measured the length of the snake to the problem area.  The images are not all that clear, but were good enough to see when I got to the roots and discern a crack in the PVC pipe.  Now comes the hard part - the crack is about two feet inside the slab-on-grade foundation, so there'll be digging and tunneling.  Considering the price (and at this writing, it's even cheaper than when I bought it), it's a good deal.  I'll add that after reading a couple of complaints about the watertightness, before using it, I sealed the camera-cable junction and the joint between the edge of the plastic lens and the camera head using Seal-All, and let it dry thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: Major design flaw
Reviews.Author: HJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this exact item and the usb connector has a flaw. The plastic housing is not an injection molded piece so the wire can twist around. i used the camera twice and the soldered wires simply broke off.Pros:- worked right out of the box- Plenty of length to use with your laptop computerCons:- looks like a cheap knockoff item someone built and soldered by hand- USB housing will break. I got two uses out of the productGo find another item which has an injected molded USB connector.

Reviews.Title: great idea, not the best quality
Reviews.Author: Whodey
Reviews.Content: Worked for what i needed it for, but not exactly waterproof. You also have to attach a snake line to it in order for it to move where you need it.

Reviews.Title: borescope camera
Reviews.Author: Tall Trees
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to find leaks in swimming pool pipe.  The first one did not work.  The return was quick and easy, but when the replacement came, I could tell it was not new.  It was not neatly rolled up in a plastic bag plus it had scratch marks down the cable where it had been fed through a pipe.  Also the lens was cracked.  Since we had removed all water in the pipe we decided to give it a try.  This one did work, but the image was of such poor quality that we were unable to see anything.  Easily returned this one as well.

Reviews.Title: one use.... is gone !!!
Reviews.Author: acbuyer
Reviews.Content: Used once for 5 minutes... it turned off... and this is it.I used in a pipe, no water running but the pipe was wet.

Reviews.Title: Worked
Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: worked for situation needed. not ideal under water, but still provided for the situation purchased for. no issues with camera or software.

Reviews.Title: Decent borescope
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: Good for inspecting/investigating pipes & small spaces but resolution needs improvement.  Plug & play works seamlessly & light control works well but can be difficult to position where desired.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Debra Scott
Reviews.Content: This imaginative gadget really does its job quite well. As a nurse I could see that it works just as a hospital facility' endoscope works.The LCD lighting brightens the darkest of small spaces and I have no trouble whatever viewing on my computers' monitor. The foot cord is a plus! In fact, it is always just the right length and sometimes with a bit left over. This product was just what I needed and I am more than pleased with my purchase. I would definitely recommend the borescope to anyone looking for this kind of item. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: This thing saved me over $800
Reviews.Author: DZ102030
Reviews.Content: I noticed dust and other accumulated schmutz in my heating system intake ducts.  I had a duct-cleaning vendor come out to examine my system and make a recommendation as to whether it needed cleaning or not.  After taking a cursory glance, the technician concluded that it needed to be cleaned, despite not even bothering to look at the ducts leading from the unit to the grates.  He spent more time figuring out how the ducts were run through the attic and walls, but only by using a flashlight while standing on a ladder in the attic.Since my system has an electrostatic filter with a traditional filter on the output side, I started to wonder if the dirty ducts were only on the input side.  So, I plunked down less than $20 for this camera.  I took off a vent / grate on the first floor, and the sheet metal duct was clean as a whistle.  I also have flexible ducts, so I figured those must be dirtier, since there is more surface area for dust and dirt to accumulate.  I taped the camera to a fish line and stuck it as far into the duct as I could get it.  I showed everything was clean, with absolutely minimal dust / pollen.  It seems doing regular maintenance on the heating system and cleaning the electrostatic cleaner twice a year really works.Needless to say, I won't be calling any duct-cleaning vendors soon.The camera works great, you can adjust the brightness of the LEDs to avoid glare, and the picture is surprisingly clear.  I had to download the software from the web and install it that way, since my Surface tablet doesn't have a DVD drive.  It took me a little while to find the download, but it is out there.Very happy with this purchase, though I've only used the camera for this particular application.  I can see where it will come in handy for other situations.  One caveat - I have no idea if it is really waterproof or not.

Reviews.Title: Works but does not record on windows 8 or 8.1.
Reviews.Author: LILLIAN
Reviews.Content: Have to be honest does not work for those windows. So do yourself a favor it will work like to see the image and the lighting is excellent but will not work for those operating system to record. only window vista or 7 not sure please of you going to purchase this purchase it just to look into a tunnel or what ever but to record on windows 8 or 8.1 not going to work. the disc that comes with it wont do that. So call amazon they have extra information on this. have a blessed day yall. One more thing it plugs into any laptop or desk top computer and shows you an image. it does that.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: T. M. P "T Mendiola"
Reviews.Content: Grear product, work as advertised! I don't see why other people complain about this product, it is good to me.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: nitpicker
Reviews.Content: I hooked this up to my PC to try it out and everything worked like it should.  It was not high definition but it was great for checking out a sewer line. The price was great and I would recommend it to anyone. I don't know how good it will be underwater because my lines were dry. I plan to seal the plastic lens cover with silicon to prevent water getting inside.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for scoping the drains!
Reviews.Author: David J. L.
Reviews.Content: Like many others I bought this to scope my drains, which were continuously blocking and backflowing out of the cleanout on the drive way (tres gross). After getting the water to flow down I used electrical tape to attach the scope to my drain rod (one of those steel tapes with an arrow head from HD), and could then just pass it down to see what remained,The camera worked great without needing drivers on my Surface Pro (maybe they auto downloaded from WU) but no driver was found on my Surface RT - both running 8.1 Update 1 - and so I had to stick to the big Surface. I just used the built in metro camera app, and set it to record video so that the machine did not sleep. The only issue I had was that at first the little wheel for controlling the light was very temperamental and the light would not stay on, but with a bit of jiggling it worked fine and lit up the drain vey well.I felt great that I'd saved so much money, and imagined myself to be Martin from Holmes Inspection :) I would post the video to show how well it works, but you really don't want to see it.

Reviews.Title: Good Choice
Reviews.Author: David Lawhorne
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed, worked well in 2" pipe. Fish helps.thru distance turns. Price was right! Leak found and pipe condition evaluated.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, Good Value, Not Submersible
Reviews.Author: .M.
Reviews.Content: Simple software application comes with it.  I didn't see any way to control the brightness of the LEDs or turn them off, but the exposure does seem to self-adjust.It is in focus from about 1.5" (may not be close enough) to several feet (perhaps to infinity).  Seems adequate.The image quality is about what I expected.  Up close, it's pretty good because of the magnification; but, at a distance of several feet, it's about equivalent to a cheap cell phone camera . . . which is OK for the price (around twenty bucks).I like the long cable.  It allows me to reach under the hood of a car, while leaving my computer on the bench.The plastic cap / lens has some fine cracks or defects in it.  I didn't put it in water, but from the look of it, there's no way it's submersible.I could almost give it 5 stars, based on the features vs. cost, but not quite.

Reviews.Title: Works OK if you understand the limitations
Reviews.Author: T. L. Williams
Reviews.Content: The CD will not play in my disk drive, but it does in an older Sony VAIO, so it works with that laptop.  The resolution is not the greatest close-up, so it is not a medical instrument.  It is an outstanding value for the tinkerer and there's countless applications like finding stuff under the refrigerator.  Just tape it to a yardstick and go to it.  I'm glad to add it to my tool arsenal.

Reviews.Title: Works great - if you follow written advice!
Reviews.Author: christopher  purvis, mr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to figure out why my laundry machine kept overflowing.  I followed the advice of others and also bought a rigid snake tape (30') to attach the camera to.  I also added some "shoe goo" around all parts of the non-lens part of the camera and about one inch past the camera head onto the cable, just to make sure it was waterproof.  I attached it to a laptop running windows vista, but had to use a video chat program to view the camera.  It worked perfectly, snaked down to about 15' and found the weird bend in my pipes that after 30 years had narrowed with gunk.  I can see many other uses as well (walls, towing my trailer, etc).  Thanks to the previous reviews that suggested ways to make this work!

Reviews.Title: Just a little silicon and it's great!
Reviews.Author: Ausum J
Reviews.Content: This camera has good quality. Cheaply put together needs a good powered USB source. (Powered hub) 30 ft cord is very handy. I would suggest sealing up the seams a bit better with some silicone before submerging. I'm taking this fishing if I don't forget I will edit review to tell how it works for that.

Reviews.Title: Endoscope Inspection Tube
Reviews.Author: VW Rick
Reviews.Content: The endoscope inspection tube is great.  Allows you to see what you normally would not be able to see.  Great for behind walls, pipes, attic crawl spaces, etc.

Reviews.Title: Works well.
Reviews.Author: Lifted Jeep
Reviews.Content: Works well, flimsy cable makes it hard to feed down spiraling pipes. You must use a wire feeder or similar to help out.Camera quality and leds are poor but at this price point you can't complain. You couldn't find just a 30ft USB extension cord at this price.Will post a pic and video later.

Reviews.Title: software Disc too small for laptops without tray drives.
Reviews.Author: Andrea L. Bergmann
Reviews.Content: the camera seems well made.  I have not used it in water  yet, but  it seems to work well in dry environments.the only Issue i see with it is the  small software cd that comes with it.  it wont work in  cd drives that  dont have a tray that slides out to receive it.  they should a have down load able driver for it. the only way i could get it to work was on a windows xp operating system using the movie maker program.  i tried to get it to work on a macbook 2007 with imovie hd., but without success for two hours of trying.  i recommend this, just know its limitations. have fun

Reviews.Title: returned because no customer service !
Reviews.Author: L. Votzmeyer "BigVotz"
Reviews.Content: couldnt get the cd software to work- appeared to be a damaged cd, and there was no info as to where to contact for replacement.looked to be pretty well constructed- really frustrating when something so simple cant be resolved !

Reviews.Title: Arrived in good shape
Reviews.Author: Joseph L Baczynski
Reviews.Content: the camera worked for what I needed it to. The view could be a little wider, sometimes hard to focus.

Reviews.Title: Succesfully used to inspect main house sewer pipe going out to septic tank
Reviews.Author: Creative Critic
Reviews.Content: Used with an old XP laptop - Just plugged it in and it worked.  I Loaded the file that came on the disk with it so I could record video -  Recording software was very easy to figure out.I figured out where the "top" of the camera was and marked it with a sharpie.  Then I Used electrical tape to tape the camera to the end of a sewer pipe fish tape keeping the mark on top.  I then wire tied the cable along the fish tape every foot or so.  The sewer pipe was not full of water but was damp with residual water along the bottom so I never really submerged the camera to see if it was waterproof.  I did a test run with the LEDs turned all the way up and they did not provide enough light.  So, I taped a mini maglight next to the camera and that worked well even with the LEDs on the camera turned all the way down so there was less reflection off the plastic lens.  I was able to see the problem - a foot long section of pipe halfway between the house and the septic tank that had the bottom rotten out.I looked at renting a real sewer cam (Ridgid See-Snake) but it was $350 for the weekend.  I figured I would try the method I used instead since the camera was so cheap and I already had a sewer fish tape.  It has saved me several hundred over renting and probably close to $1000 if I were to of had hired someone to do the inspection.  The resolution was good enough for this application.  I would give it five stars if the LEDS were bright enough and I did not need to use an additional light.I recommend this product if you need to inspect your main house sewer pipe and you want to save some $.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Design
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on a recommendation and it's one I wish I wouldn't have listened to.  The product is cheap quality and whoever designed it didn't think about it's practical purpose.  The camera end has a very blunt tip on it with little or no control over the end of the scope such as wire placed 3 ft in length on the head end to bend it in a certain direction.  Unless your using this on straight pipe with clear line of sight it's worthless.  You'll spend hours just trying to get around a corner never mind a joint in the pipe.  The blunt tip catches everything along.  Since you have no control over the head and it's weighted like it is, the head will lean into the side of the pipe causing the blunt head to take an angled landing.Now I know what your thinking....just keep ramming it till it breaks free.  I thought the same thing and tried that.  Because of the aforementioned blunt weighted head it just keep landing on the joint at an angle because you can't steer it into the center of the pipe as you could if there was a wire in the casing to bend it opposite of the direction your pipes lean going down.  I tried to add an external wire and it really wasn't much help since it was just another thing to catch on things.Overall, worthless product.  More of a play toy then anything.  Now it does work good to see if you dropped some thing down the drain without having to pull the P trap but you won't need a 10M on for that.  Honestly don't waste your money and time with this product.  Even the head was designed to big for older homes plumbing and the angles you can get in pipes when dealing with that.  Giant waste of money for anything more then a play toy.

Reviews.Title: WORTHLESS
Reviews.Author: Robert R. Ward "WARDY"
Reviews.Content: I FOUND ITEM TO BE TOTALLY WORTHLESS. THE LIGHT WOULD NOT ILLUMINATE THE PIPE AND THE FOCUS WAS IMPOSSIBLE TO GET A DECENT VIEW

Reviews.Title: Worked great for me.  I was able to find the clog in our central vac line.
Reviews.Author: Joe M "Colsar"
Reviews.Content: I can see how some people have had trouble with this.  It isn't very heavy duty, but my job was lightweight so I figured it would be fine.  I taped it to a wire fish line about an inch behind the hook so I could see the tip of the hook in the video.  I was able to fish the camera right up to the block and see how far it was and what it looked like.  I used a Kissler canister auger stretched out to the right length and was able to hook the clog and pull it out.  I think I found where all the hair my cat shed went to.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product for the price
Reviews.Author: Dennis Sullivan
Reviews.Content: Less expensive than a cheap borescope and much more flexible.  Who needs a tiny display these days when we all have laptops.  Plug it into your laptop and use your own camera app.  Be sure to configure your app to use this new camera.  I have a Windows 8 box and it works well.Caution: The instructions are poor (as you would expect with a product at this price) so you may need to find a teenager to help with the computer:-)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Pablo U. Suarez Joya
Reviews.Content: This one great purchase I was able to see the pipes of my central vacuumand the house regular pipes. The seller was prompt in mailing the cameraand the price was excellent. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price I paid.
Reviews.Author: ANGEL ORTIZ
Reviews.Content: the cable line was not rigid enough to go completely through to the clog, and the camara dragged along the pipe picking up mud and accumulating on the camara. I was impressed with the camaras clarity though.

Reviews.Title: No more heavy lifting to search.
Reviews.Author: John W. Van Hoy III
Reviews.Content: I got this when I shopped for a veterinary otoscope and it was down the page.  It comes with a set up DVD and allows you so look behind and under places with out moving heavy furniture.  I guess it would also work for looking down drains in sinks.  The end is brightly lighted so you can see well.  I use it with my laptop and will try to move the DVD stuff to my iPad to make things a even more portable.

Reviews.Title: Works with Surface RT and recent laptops
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I was able to use this with my surface RT.  All I needed to do was plug it in the USB port, and then change the driver to Microsoft default USB camera. Worked like a charm.  The focal distance seems to be about 3 inches, but for what this device is designed to do, it is great.  I was looking at the various $200 plus tools that have their own power source, and view finder, but the fact this was only around $20 made it worth the shot.  It seems to me that this will have many more uses than those stand alone devices as well.  It may be inconveint to have my laptop or tablet near me when I'm using this, but the fact that it is 10M long instead of just 1M, really mitigates those concerns.  I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: CD type and image magnification fixed
Reviews.Author: Otto Kopper
Reviews.Content: Difficult to read small CD on my computer need to read on other computer, product doest have a web page to down load program either.Also product doesn't have image dismagnification or adjustIt can be better with small program changes.

Reviews.Title: The First One Was Defective
Reviews.Author: Steve Foote
Reviews.Content: The first one I received was defective. Windows reported it as a defective device right from the start when I plugged it in and on checking it was not even supplying a hardware ID to Windows. I am assuming it was just bad luck to get a defective one so I am exchanging it. If the second works OK I'll post that.

Reviews.Title: Consider better quality
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: purchased for use in walls, did not work well....suggest something of better quality.  Camera quality is poor.  Difficult to see anything.

Reviews.Title: It's ok; a waste of $35 bucks is not the end of the world
Reviews.Author: Boyan Biandov
Reviews.Content: Image quality is terrible; it only focuses when an object is about an inch from the camera. The value is in the USB cable and the LEDs. I am thinking of replacing the image sensor with a good quality one from old Logitech cam and get some decent focus action and overall image quality. Oh well; I sort of expected this.

Reviews.Title: Very helpful when you need it.
Reviews.Author: MaryL
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my husband for his birthday, as he has most tools that he would need and I was running out of ideas.  He loved it.  Easy to hook up and he used it to see into a closet that we couldn't get open and found out what was blocking the latch.  Was able to manuver and move the item and now we have the closet open and no damage to the door. It worked well with his laptop Win XP.  Cost less than a new closet door.

Reviews.Title: Performed just like it was advertised.
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: light is adequate picture quality is OK. We have gotten spoiled by the high quality computer displays. Great camera for the price

Reviews.Title: Had a little problem with the first one But the  second one worked GREAT
Reviews.Author: James D Joaquim
Reviews.Content: These borescopes come in very handy when you are looking at the inside of  low prosser welded pipe.Works great for for my needs.

Reviews.Title: For the money the clarity is fine.
Reviews.Author: Przy
Reviews.Content: Considering the price, the image provided is quite good.  Although i haven't actually used it in a pipe yet so can't comment on how water resistant it actually is.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY HERE.
Reviews.Author: Jim Schuler
Reviews.Content: I was sent a used product. And the disk with the program and drivers is damaged. A replacement was not offered. Find someone else to buy from. This was a waist of money.

Reviews.Title: not great
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: 10m 30ft waterproof USB Borescope  endoscope inspection pipe camera was not at a good thing to buy it is not clear and you realy can not make anything out it would be a insalt  to trash it touches in the garbage pale not happy

Reviews.Title: SHOULD COME WITH ACCOMPANYING SOFTWARE
Reviews.Author: Jack Hickey
Reviews.Content: It would have been nice if it came with software, rather than me having to search for a compatible program?!

ProductInfo.Features:
A new electronic health and industrial pipeline inspection product, you can use it to examination, ear detection. search and rescue, pipeline inspection, engine inspection, video monitor, sewer inspection; cast mould in wall inspection.
This portable Digital Microscope must be connected to the computer when using. User interface is very friendly. You can do the micro-measure work with easy,
Waterproof wire endoscope, 4 LED low lux luminance lights can work better when the light very dark.
XP system can watch video directly without install software, Vista or Win 7 needs install software which in the CD.
Can take photo (XP system can use itself photo function to take photo or use our software, other system need use our software to take photo), Can record video, and save the video in the PC.
ProductInfo.Name: 10M 30ft Waterproof USB Borescope Endoscope Inspection Tube Pipe Camera
